CONJUGATES: tennis player | tennis court | tennis shoe
ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English, probably from Anglo-Norman tenetz, plural imperative of tenir ('to hold, receive, take'), shouted by the server before serving in the medieval game of jeu de paume.

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A racket sport played on a rectangular court, either singles (two players) or doubles (four players), in which players use strung rackets to hit a ball over a net into the opponent's court.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种球拍运动，在矩形球场上进行，分为单打（两人）或双打（四人），球员使用穿线的球拍将球击过球网至对方场地。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He took up tennis after watching the Wimbledon championships.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 看了温布尔登锦标赛后，他开始打网球。
